on September 14th Spire filed its annual
rate stabilization adjustment Rider RSA
for the 12 months ending June 30th 2022

recent 12-month period ending June 30th

dollars

reduce the overall rate increase from

Entergy Mississippi LLC notice of intent

Options schedule rco Mr Mabry
thank you Mr chairman Commissioners on
January 20th EML filed a notice of
intent to make routine changes in rates
and schedules related to its proposed
renewable Community option rate schedule
or schedule rco EML intends to provide
this new option to non-residential
customers meaning just industrial
commercial and governmental customers to
receive benefits of Renewable Power
associated with eml's utility scale
renewable resources when those customers
cannot or choose not to install solar
facilities on their own properties I.E
net metering EML seeks to make schedule
rco available to eligible EML customers
by providing those customers an
opportunity to receive value from a 40
megawatt portion of the 100 megawatt
sunflower solar facility in Sunflower
County participants will pay a fixed
monthly charge of seven dollars per
kilowatt hour based on their portion of
the 40 megawatts available at sunflower
They will receive offsetting Bill
Credits based on their share of miso
energy revenue and have the renewable
energy credits a wreck associated with
their share of actual output retired on
their behalf EML proposes to use the
actual energy output I.E the solar PV
output of the sunflower solar facility
or other applicable generating resources
to calculate the monthly credits however
to timely apply the credits to customers
bills when the rco subscription charge
appears on bills EML proposes to apply
the actual energy output that was
recorded two months before the
customer's billing period using a
two-month lag for energy output will
allow the company to gather information
about actual solar production and ensure
that the customers receive credits on
their bills when the schedule rco
charges are billed as such EML expects
that customers enrolled when the
facility is placed into service will not
pay a subscription charge or receive a
bill credit until the third month third
full month of operation
although 40 megawatts of the sunflower
solar facility's capacity will be
allocated to schedule rco this does not
change the rule the sunflower solar
facility will have as part of eml's
generating Fleet that serves all EML
customers the energy produced by
sunflower solar facility will be used to
meet the needs of all eml's entire
customer base and the fuel savings
provided by the facility will continue
to be fully reflected in the fuel
adjustment built to all EML customers
the subscription charge revenue from
participants will be credited annually
through the company's formula rate plan
to offset a portion of the revenue
requirement for the sunflower solar
facility
in addition the bill credits provided to
participants will be offset by miso
energy Market Revenue received from the
sunflower solar facility staff
recommends approval
